Why is this in a separate thread?

close() blocks till all its dependers are shutdown. So close() has to be called in the reverse dependency order. Making close run in a different thread allows the caller to call close on a bunch of services in any order. Also this promotes parallelization while closing out services
If that's what you want, I would rather let the caller decide to make it run in a separate thread.

Another reason as shirley pointed out is that close blocks till dependersExit but returns before the service actually closes. From the callers perspective its blocking but does not ensure that the service is closed when the method returns. Making the close asynchronous feels more intuitive IMO.
Why are we limiting this to GenericExternalService? We need a way to remove any service don't we?
